chapter.title: Working with Applications
chapter.para: In the Applications view, you can review existing application and script definitions as well as create new script and application definitions.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you need to create all subordinate objects (external programs, scripts, Java classes) before defining the application (for more information, see ).

chapter.para: You can define applications for different use cases including input processing (import), output processing and post processing.
An application consists of up to four commands. Each of these commands can be an external program, a JavaScript or a Java command. The commands are executed in the following order:

note.para: In case of an error, the error command is executed after the main command has been processed.

chapter.para: You can define external programs, Java classes, script commands and applications in the configuration interface &dbwp; in Process Configuration General Settings Definitions (for more information, see ).

note.para: If you make changes to the definitions in the web interface, please keep in mind that you must also make these changes in &dbwp;. Otherwise, your changes will be overwritten the next time you deploy the respective processing unit.

chapter.para: The following actions are supported in the Applications view:

sect1.title: Creating an Application
sect1.para: You can define a new application in the web interface to start an external application or execute a Java command (for more information, see ).
Proceed as follows to create a new application.

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: A new entry with empty fields is created in the overview table. The ID and Main Command fields contain mandatory information and are therefore highlighted in red (marked as incorrect) while they do not contain valid entries.

step.para: Enter a name for the new application in the ID field.
In the Main Command field, select the called command or external application from the dropdown list.
In the Pre-Command field, select the command or application that is executed before the main command from the dropdown list.
In the Post-Command field, select the command or application that is executed after the main command from the dropdown list.
In the Error Command field, select the command or application to be executed in case of an error from the dropdown list.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new application and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new application is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the application and exit the editing mode without saving the application.

sect1.title: Listing Applications
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured applications in the workspace of the Applications view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured application by default:

listitem.para: The unique identifier of the application.
Status of the application. Valid values are:
The invoked command or external application.
Command or application that is to be executed before the main command.

note.para: If an error occurs while executing the pre-command, the main command may not be executed or may also end with an error.

listitem.para: Command or application that is to be executed after the main command.

note.para: If an error occurs while executing the main command, the post-command may not be executed or may also end with an error.

listitem.para: Command or application that is to be executed in case of an error. The specified command is executed if an error occurs while executing the main command.

sect1.title: Displaying Application Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific application in the details pane. Currently, the details pane contains additional information (type) that is not available in the overview table.

sect1.title: Setting Parameters
sect1.para: If you have selected an entry from the overview table, you can display and/or set execution parameters for the application in the details pane in the Parameters tab. For example, if you invoke cpmcopy, you can set e.g. parameters like infile (specifying the input filename) or logdir (specifying the log directory).
The available parameters depend on the executed application or script. By default, the list of available execution parameters is empty. Proceed as follows to set new parameters:

step.para: In the Applications view, select the desired application from the overview table.
In the details pane of the selected application, click the Parameters tab.

result.para: The empty parameter list is displayed in the details pane.

step.para:
In the navigation bar of the details pane, click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The input mask for parameters opens in the details pane.
The following actions are available in the input mask.

listitem.para: You can edit the parameter name and value of each entry.

You can remove each entry by clickig Button Delete
(Delete).

By clicking Add Button
(Add) next to the last entry, you can add a new parameter.

step.para: In the first text field, specify the parameter name.
In the second text field, specify the parameter value.

In the navigation bar of the details pane, click Save Button
(Save) to save the changes and exit the editing mode for all parameter entries.

In the navigation bar of the details pane, click Button Cancel
(Cancel) to exit the editing mode without saving the changes.

result.para: The editing mode for all parameter entries is terminated.

By clicking Edit Button
(Edit), you can re-open the parameter list in edit mode.

sect1.title: Modifying an Application
sect1.para: You can edit the application properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you can not use this action to edit the application name. To modify the application name, create a new application with the desired name (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing application:

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

note.para: Please keep in mind that this action cannot be used to modify the ID or type of the selected application.

step.para: In the Main Command field, select the called command or external application from the dropdown list.
In the Pre-Command field, select the command or application that is executed before the main command from the dropdown list.
In the Post-Command field, select the command or application that is executed after the main command from the dropdown list.
In the Error Command field, select the command or application to be executed in case of an error from the dropdown list.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the application with the new values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the application is displayed with the new values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel editing the application and exit the edit mode without saving the changes.

sect1.para: Besides editing the properties, you can also define new parameters for the application execution or modify existing parameters (for more information, see ).

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Applications
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple applications in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected applications.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the properties of the selected applications.

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.
Select at least two applications from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).

result.para: The Edit dialog opens.

step.para: Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected applications.
In the Main Command field, specify the command or external application that is to be executed.
In the Before Command field, specify the command or application that is to be executed before the main command.
In the After Command field, specify the command or application that is to be executed after the main command.
In the Error Command field, specify the command or application that is to be executed in case of an error.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected applications and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected applications are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.para: Besides editing the properties, you can also define new parameters for the application execution or modify existing parameters (for more information, see ).

sect1.title: Starting an Application
sect1.para: You can start a configured application in the web interface to start an external application or execute a Java command (for more information, see ).
Proceed as follows to start an application.

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Start
(Execute):

result.para: The configured application is started.

note.para: If an error occurs while trying to start the application, check the log file for details.

sect1.title: Stopping an Application
sect1.para: You can stop a running application (external application or Java command) (for more information, see ).
Proceed as follows to stop an application.

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Stop
(Stop).

result.para: The execution of the configured application is stopped.

note.para: If an error occurs while trying to stop the application, check the log file for details.

sect1.title: Managing Execution Parameters for the Application
sect1.para: In addition to editing the properties (see ), you can also define new parameters for the application execution or modify or delete existing parameters. Proceed as follows to edit the parameters of an existing application:

step.para: Double-click the desired row in the overview table of the Applications view

result.para: The entry is highlighted.

step.para: In the details pane of the selected entry, click the Parameters tab.

Click Button Edit
(Edit) to create a new entry.

result.para: A new parameter entry is created.

step.para: Enter the desired parameter name in the first input field.
Enter the desired value of the new parameter in the second input field.

Click Button Save
(Save) to save the new parameter entry.

note.para: If you create multiple parameters in one step, all new parameters are saved.

sect1.para: Besides creating new parameters, you can also edit the properties of existing parameters. Proceed as follows to edit an existing parameter:

step.para: Double-click the desired row in the overview table of the Applications view

result.para: The entry is highlighted.

step.para: In the details pane of the selected entry, click the Parameters tab.

Click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: All existing parameters are opened for editing.

step.para: Enter the desired new values or parameter names.

Click Button Save
(Save) to save the changed parameter(s).

note.para: If you have modified multiple parameters in one step, all changes are saved.

sect1.para: In addition to creating and editing parameters, you can also delete parameters in the details pane. Proceed as follows to delete existing parameters:

step.para: Double-click the desired row in the overview table of the Applications view

result.para: The entry is highlighted.

step.para: In the details pane of the selected entry, click the Parameters tab.

Click Button Edit
(Edit).

result.para: All existing parameters are opened for editing.

step.para:
Next to the parameter you want to delete, click Delete button
(Delete).

result.para: The parameter is removed from the overview.

step.para:
Click Button Save
(Save) to save your changes.

sect1.title: Deleting Applications
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single application or multiple applications. Proceed as follows to delete existing applications.

step.para: Switch to the Applications view.
Select at least one application from the overview table.

note.para: To select an entry, tick the checkbox next to the desired entry.

step.para:
In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Applications opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Applications, click OK to delete the selected application (or applications).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Applications, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected application(s).

result.para: If the application(s) has (have) been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed in a separate dialog.
If the application(s) could not be deleted, the corresponding error message is displayed in a separate dialog.
